awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  REDUCTION OF TWO-STROKE ENGINE EMISSIONS BY MEANS OF ROTARY EXHAUST VALVES
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project is reduced emissions for conventional engines. Engine emissions directly impact the environment, public health, and wildlife. Improved engine design can operate in parallel with other  energy-efficient measures with minimal need for new infrastructure.  The proposed project advances a new engine architecture designed for efficiency and reduced emissions. 

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project will yield a new engine technology for a low-cost, high-power density, environmentally-friendly two-stroke engine. The proposed system will: address shortcomings of a traditional two-stroke engine, eliminate oil from the combustion process, offer durability, and control combustion and emissions.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Our project, supported by the NSF, aimed to redefine internal combustion engine technology with a clear focus on sustainability, efficiency, and adaptability to future fuel sources. Our efforts have culminated in the development of an engine technology that not only meets today's stringent demands for lower emissions and higher efficiency but is also engineered to seamlessly adapt to carbon-neutral fuels. This forward-thinking approach underscores our commitment to contributing to a more sustainable and cleaner energy future.

We have pioneered an innovative engine technology that demonstrates remarkable advancements in both efficiency and emissions reduction. Our work has reimagined engine operational modes by separating the pumping work from the power cell, thereby offering unprecedented control over conditions both pre- and post-combustion. This supports the engine's fuel-agnostic capabilities, ensuring it is ready for the evolving energy landscape. The project has introduced innovative hardware and control techniques, underscoring our significant contributions to engine technology and laying the groundwork for future innovations.

Beyond the immediate environmental benefits, our technology stands as a transformative solution designed to augment the electrification of transportation and energy systems. Recognizing the critical role of hybrid systems in the transition towards a more sustainable energy ecosystem, our engine technology has been specifically developed to support hybrid applications. By offering a high-power density, low-emission alternative that can operate on a variety of fuels, including future carbon-neutral options, our engine enhances the viability and performance of hybrid systems, providing a bridge between conventional fuels and full electrification.

Furthermore, our technology addresses the growing demand for off-grid charging solutions and emergency and backup power generation. Its adaptability and efficiency make it an ideal candidate for powering off-grid charging stations, supporting the expansion of electric vehicle infrastructure in areas lacking robust electrical grid connectivity. This capability is particularly crucial as we move towards greater adoption of electrified applications, ensuring that charging infrastructure keeps pace with this transition.

In emergency and backup power generation, the versatility and reliability of our engine technology offer a significant advantage. Designed to operate on a variety of fuel types, our technology provides a dependable source of power in situations where traditional energy sources may be unavailable or infeasible. This feature is especially important in disaster response scenarios or remote locations, where access to power can be critical.

As we advance towards the commercialization of our technology, we emphasize its role in supporting the electrification of transportation and energy systems. Our engine technology is not just an improvement over existing solutions; it is a transformative approach that enables the integration of renewable energy sources, supports the infrastructure for electrification, and provides reliable power when and where it's needed most.

In summary, our NSF-supported project has developed an engine technology that is both a testament to the potential for significant environmental improvements and a strategic component in the broader shift towards electrification and sustainable energy solutions. By enhancing hybrid systems, enabling off-grid charging, and ensuring reliable backup power, our technology is poised to play a crucial role in the transition to a cleaner, more sustainable energy future.


Last Modified: 04/01/2024
Modified by: John Krzeminski

Image
  • Revolutionizing Sustainability: A Compact, Fuel-Agnostic Engine Embraces Carbon-Neutral Fuels for Next-Generation Range Extenders and Portable Power Generation
    Strange Development, Inc
    Copyrighted
    John Krzeminski
    REVolution Engine Technology by Strange Development
